newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bank of France holds intervention rate at 3.10 pct.
newsitem.headline: Bank of France holds intervention rate at 3.10 pct.

text.p: The Bank of France said on Tuesday it was leaving its intervention rate unchanged at 3.10 percent.
The central bank announced the unchanged interest rate ahead of a same-day money market tender taking place later on Tuesday.
The rate, usually announced on Monday, was given on Tuesday because the tender was delayed by the Easter Monday holiday.
Economists had not expected a change in rates.
The Bank continued to post its five-to-10 day rate at 4.60 percent.

The intervention rate, at which the central bank allocates repo funds, was last cut -- from 3.15 percent -- on January 30, 1997. The Bank last cut its five-to-10 day lending rate, by 15 basis points from 4.75 percent, on December 17, 1996.
